body: Boards thread quality is so shit lmao.

Counted it and there are 15 threads or so on the front page about how bad the new hud is.

wow 15 threads on a server with over a million accounts



SUCH A HUGE MAJORITY.
Everyone posting about how bad the hud is are the small majority to impatient to let it settle in and arent giving the changes time.
The crashing will be fixed, there are alot of other small problems but they are all going to be fixed because riot obviously didnt plan for them to be part of the new hud... DUH.

Also there were just as many if not more negative threads about the summoners rift graphical update, look where all those haters are now...

lmao what, OCE might have over 1 mil accounts, probably not, but there's no way it has over 1 mil unique players.
still 15 threads compared to hundreds of thousands of players.

There's about 20-30 people who use boards regularly, with about 20-40 who use them on occasion (maybe a little more, this is just an educated guess). Compared to the amount of people who actually use boards 15 people/threads is a big percentage.

the people who use boards only have a reason to use them (complain and seek attention) where as the majority of players couldnt care less about the boards because 1. they arent complaining about the hud and like it or acknowledge it will take time or 2. arent seeking attention with their complaints and are just sucking it up instead of threatening to quit the game

> [{quoted}](name=i am flawless,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XKWAKT1a,comment-id=000200000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-07-24T10:53:29.287+0000)

I use boards because I want to be part of the community. Most people that use boards to complain or seek attention make a few threads then leave. Other stick around for weeks, months, years before leaving.

I think you misunderstand my point. I'm saying that, for the people who use the boards regularly/occasionally all these threads about how "crap" the new HUD is are an eyesore/annoyance. If there were significantly more people using the boards, it wouldn't be as big an issue but, as it is, there aren't that many people who actually use the boards on a regular/semi-regular basis.
